com.aconex.challenge.numbertowords.dictionary

Class NumbersEncodingParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aconex.challenge.numbertowords.dictionary.NumbersEncodingParser

  • public class NumbersEncodingParser
extends Object
    This is a utility class which by default parses an internal file containing the number encoding and stores the encoding as a map, which can be retrieved later.

    It has two constructors the no-arg one would parse an internal file which has the default encoding. At the same time it has another constructor can take a InputStreamReader for a different set of encoding.
    It expects each line of the reader having a set of characters mapping to a number. Characters are separated from each other by a comma, and the set of characters and numbers delimitted by an an arrow.
    An example of a line of the InputStreamReader is as below
    A,B,C -> 2

    Comments can be added by having # character at the beginning of the line
    And the default encoding is
    A,B,C -> 2
    D,E,F -> 3
    G,H,I -> 4
    J,K,L -> 5
    M,N,O -> 6
    P,Q,R,S -> 7
    T,U,V -> 8
    W,X,Y,Z -> 9

    Author:
    aagarwal

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NumbersEncodingParser()
      No-arg constructor which would parse an internal encoding file and create the mapping.
      Parsing is done as a part of the constructor so that when the method getCharToDigitEncoding() the encoding map is available
      NumbersEncodingParser(InputStreamReader numbersEncodingReader)
      Creates an encoding map from an external mapping source

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Map<String,String> getCharToDigitEncoding()
      Returns the encoding map such that each character has its own key

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
